text: Christmas Carol By Christina Rossetti In the bleak mid winter Frosty wind made moan Earth stood hard as iron Water like a stone Snow had fallen snow on snow Snow on snow In the bleak mid winter Long ago Our God Heaven cannot hold Him Nor earth sustain Heaven and earth shall flee away When He comes to reign In the bleak midwinter stable place sufficed The Lord God Almighty Jesus Christ Enough for Him whom cherubim Worship night and day breastful of milk And a mangerful of hay Enough for Him whom angels Fall down before The ox and ass and camel Which adore Angels and archangels May have gathered there Cherubim and seraphim Thronged the air But only His mother In her maiden bliss Worshipped the Beloved With a kiss What can I give Him Poor as I am If I were a shepherd I would bring a lamb If I were a Wise Man I would do my part Yet what I can I give Him Give my heart Becky Biberstein Michael Green Frances Carr Tom Richhart Troy Cook Bobbie Jackson Kimberly Abney Sydnee Bradburn Lean ne Lee Jeff Tillman and Richard Payne The Nativity of the Lord December 25 2024 Merry Christmas Whether you are a lifelong parishioner or a visiting guest we are so happy that you have joined us to celebrate the Nativity of our Lord Jesus Christ May the Lord fill your hearts with the joy of His peace as we rejoice together in the birth of the Christ child If this is your first time here at St Josephs or if you are recently returning we would love to welcome you back every weekend throughout the Christmas season and beyond As quickly as it may have seemed that Christmas has come may we not forget that our celebration has only just begun The joy of Christmas cannot be contained in a single day but is instead in the life of the Church a season within itself I encourage you keep the tree up Let the Christmas lights continue to shine Continue to play Christmas music Christ is born What more reason do we need to continue this celebration Continue to rejoice Parish Christmas Gifts Bible Basics for Catholics by Dr John Bergsma This book may look small but it contains something very big inside a profound summary of Gods plan in Sacred Scripture Given the size of the Bible and how much time and effort it takes to thoroughly explore it a little help can go a long way This book offers more than a little help In Bible Basics for Catholics Scripture Scholar Dr John Bergsma provides us with the big picture of the Bible by focusing on the covenant story of Gods plan for His children Employing a conversational style and simple illustrations throughout the book Bergsma helps us to understand the ancient world of the Bible and discover how it is still meaningful for their lives today Historic Ornament for our Parish Family 1875 2025 In just a few days as we welcome the coming New Year our parish begins celebrating her sesquicentennial anniversary To mark the start of this momentous event we have a special a gift to our Parish Family Parish Christmas Ornament The ornament sports our parish logo highlighting the year our parish was first recognized by the Diocese of Fort Wayne 1875 The surrounding stained glass on the ornament helps to call to mind the beautiful stained glass windows that adorn our parish Church I would like to thank the Adult Choir Children's Choir Cantors and Musicians for all your hard work in preparing for our Christmas Liturgies May you all have a very Blessed Christmas Season Teresa With humble gratitude to everyone who sent a card or Christmas gift Thank you To my Parish Family May God bless you and your family abundantly in the coming New Year Know of my continued prayers for you and your family Michelle Christmas means open presents building a snowman hot chocolate family writing letters to Santa going outside celebrating Jesus birthday Getting Christmas trees to set up in the house Its the holiday of being with my family and feeling of love by Hunter Lehman grade 2 The joy of Christmas and celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ and even though He was just a baby He was the Messiah The True King Jesus was born in a stable in Beth lehem in the city of David The joy of Christmas is finding Jesus Another thing that Christmas means to me is spending time with family and friends Another thing is rejoicing because Jesus has been born Also that Jesus chose a human loving mother named Mary to protect Him and care for Him Jesus chose a poor family to be His family he didn't want to be rich because He wanted every family to love Him He chose a raggedy stable to be His birthplace It makes me happy because Jesus did a big sacrifice for me By Sophia Spisak Grade 4 Christmas means a way of expressing your gratification and appreciation of others through physical gifts because our love for one another is incomprehensible We try to express it through gift giving by Luke Dreiband Grade 12 To celebrate the birth of Christ and get together with family and friends It is the caring for one another it is also a time of reflection and prayer That is what Christmas means to me by Joao Carlos Calduro Grade 8 Christmas means that Jesus was born I love going to Mass and praying on Christmas day by Louis
